intro: Dichaetanthera articulata, commonly known as the articulated dichaetanthera, is a flowering plant species native to South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowers are typically greenish or brownish, and the plant produces small, three-angled fruits. Dichaetanthera articulata is often found in grasslands and open habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
